intro: Sterculia borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean sterculia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring large, palmately lobed leaves and showy yellow flowers with red stamens. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. The plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in local medicine.
